page.title: 11FARMING 1
page.content: As there are many farms in our area, most of the land is farmland and most of the farmland is{grassland which cows and sheep graze on. Some of it, though, is made into hay and cultivated. The fields are contained by hedges but the hedges are slowly being taken down to make bigger fields with fences so that animals cannot stray into other farmers'land. A very small area of the land belongs to Seale{Hayne Agricultural College}and about six acres belong to the{English {China Clay}pits. Trees are being knocked down too, because some are in the middle of fields which mean people have to go round them when making hay or ploughing so they "lose" some land All the farmers have modern farming implements.
